meanings.sent1: The pickled cucumbers added a tangy flavor to the sandwich.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy eating pickled vegetables with my meals.
meanings.sent3: The pickled onions danced on my taste buds with excitement.
meanings.sent4: Her pickled sense of humor always brought a smile to my face.
meanings.sent5: The pickled peppers sparkled like jewels in the jar.

meanings.sent1: After too many drinks, he stumbled around, feeling pickled.
meanings.sent2: She regretted getting pickled at the party last night.
meanings.sent3: The pickled party guests laughed loudly at everything.
meanings.sent4: The pickled revelers sang off-key but with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The pickled friends shared stories and giggled uncontrollably.

meanings.definition: To preserve in vinegar or brine
meanings.sent1: She learned how to pickle cucumbers from her grandmother.
meanings.sent2: The chef decided to pickle the excess vegetables for later use.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally pickled his socks in the laundry with vinegar.
meanings.sent4: The tradition of pickling fruits has been passed down for generations.
meanings.sent5: The pickled eggs sat in the jar, waiting to be enjoyed.

meanings.definition: To choose or select from a group
meanings.sent1: I will pickled the best apples for the pie.
meanings.sent2: She carefully pickled the ripest tomatoes from the garden.
meanings.sent3: He always seemed to pickled the most interesting books to read.
meanings.sent4: The coach will pickled the players for the upcoming match.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to pickled a partner for the project.
